recipes.title: Cookie Butter Rice Krispie Balls

winePairing.pairingText: Rice Crispy Treats on the menu? Try pairing with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 19 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: Add butter to a sauce pan over low/medium heat. Melt and then add large marshmallows. Stir until marshmallows have melted and then add cookie spread. Stir until lightly melted and then remove from heat.Add rice krispies and miniature marshmallows to the mix and stir until well coated.Line a baking sheet with wax paper and create 1 inch size balls using a spoon or cookie scoop. Roll in between hands before placing on wax paper.Tip: Spray scoop with non-stick spray and hands so mixture doesn't stick to hands.

steps.step: Add butter to a sauce pan over low/medium heat. Melt and then add large marshmallows. Stir until marshmallows have melted and then add cookie spread. Stir until lightly melted and then remove from heat.
Add rice krispies and miniature marshmallows to the mix and stir until well coated.Line a baking sheet with wax paper and create 1 inch size balls using a spoon or cookie scoop.
Roll in between hands before placing on wax paper.Tip: Spray scoop with non-stick spray and hands so mixture doesn't stick to hands.
